The match began at 7:00 pm IST.
Rahul Tripathi made his T20I debut.
Sri Lanka racked up 206 for 6 in their 20 overs
India were reduced to 57 for 5 in the 10th over
Sri Lanka hammered 93 runs in the last six overs
Arshdeep Singh bowled five no-balls in the innings.
Sri Lanka scored 77 runs in the final five overs of their innings.
The match was held at Maharashtra Cricket Association Stadium, Pune.
India and Sri Lanka have both won one game each at the MCA Stadium in Gahunje.
India were left to rue a top-order collapse and five no-balls from Arshdeep Singh
The second T20I match was played at the Maharashtra Cricket Association Stadium, Pune.
The match was televised on Star Sports Network in India and streamed live on Disney+Hotstar.
